[[i]]The Ice Queen has given me command of Dervingard. There are rumours that Ursun was last seen in the Chaos Wastes. Without our god, Kislev suffers. I will do my best to protect the Motherland through this harsh winter.[[/i]]\\n\\n First entry, the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]I see a world drowned in fire and blood, where madness is the only reason.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]I will lead my followers through the Chaos Wastes. In the north stirs a power like no other.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]I cannot bow to another. I would rather rule a barren wasteland than serve in the court of Kislev.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]There is no glory in serving Kislev. Serve the Dark Gods and the riches of the world are yours.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]I burn the writings of the Great Orthodoxy. From this day forward, I follow the ancient texts of the Dark Gods  only they have true meaning.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]The Northmen only respect strength and power, so I performed their trials and soon they were bowing down to me.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]The northern tribes rarely listen to reason, but spill their blood and they follow my every command.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]There is nothing you can do, save kneel before the Dark Gods. Only they bestow true power.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]True power lies in the hands of the Dark Gods. I am enlightened.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]The hand of Chaos casts a vast, impenetrable shadow upon the world, and it cannot be banished or defeated.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]The Boyar I replace is a fool. On my arrival, I find Dervingard in disarray. Northern tribesmen, sworn enemies of Kislev, mixing freely and making heretical pacts with the garrison. I have executed the former commander for dereliction.[[/i]] \\n\\n The Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]Fools take refuge in faith. It is no hiding place from the reach of Chaos.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]Chaos crawls from the darkness to possess the world. All life will descend into a seething mass of screaming souls.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]Kislev is but a speck to the Dark Gods. Their power is immeasurable, they cannot be overcome. The reign of Chaos has begun.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]Descent in the ranks cannot be tolerated. If I make an example of one, then a thousand will serve without question.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]Fear me Kislev, for I serve the Dark Gods and their armies rally behind me.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]I walked across a bridge of bones beneath a brazen sky. All about me were the skulls of the slain.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]I pledge myself to the Dark Gods. Let me be worthy in your eyes. Let me revel in your power and be rewarded with Dark Gifts.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]What does Kislev know of conquest? They fight taking backward steps. They know not how to be victorious.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]I promised Kislev to spill the blood of my enemy. I kept my promise, but the blood is my kin's.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]The Wastes are a barren wilderness stalked by all manner of gruesome Daemons and roving tribes. It matters not, I will subjugate them all.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]Ursun's roar to break winter remains unheard. The God-Bear's hibernation has gone on for too long. There are tales he sleeps in the far north, but do we dare venture so deep into the Chaos Wastes?[[/i]]\\n\\n The Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]Hear me, Gods of Chaos, bestow me with your favour. Grant me gifts to enslave the north, for I turn my back on Kislev.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz
[[i]]Our life is but a tiny candle in the darkness, but I will show the Dark Gods how brightly my flame can burn.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]The people of Kislev are petty mortals, chosen only for death. I have been chosen for greatness by the Dark Gods themselves.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]The only wickedness is that of the Great Orthodoxy. It is their lies that blind, their faith that distorts. Reject their teachings and discover the truth about Chaos.[[/i]]\\n\\nWritten in dark runes translated from the Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]The Northmen tribes are always at our walls. Dervingard holds, but I cannot rest. And the few moments of sleep I take are plagued with dreams of Daemons We do not belong here.[[/i]]\\n\\n The Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]I am convinced the enchantress, Zorya, is a spy for the Ice Queen. Watching my every move. Judging me. Condemning the books I read. I shall hide them, and remain silent to her complaints.[[/i]]\\n\\n The Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]I have seen what troubles me. It is not a missing god, it is the meek that rely on it, that let the Motherland shrivel. Kislev is no longer my concern. I have wandered the Wastes looking for gods and all I see is power to be taken.[[/i]]\\n\\n The Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]They call him the Wolf. He prowls with his pack outside the walls of Dervingard. The serfs cower and look to me for protection. I have no time for cowards  I look to the north, where true power lies.[[/i]]\\n\\n The Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]Dervingard can rot for all I care. I journey to the far reaches of the Chaos Wastes. Those loyal are eager to share in the power we shall amass. The rest, I leave to the Wolf  let him feed on the cravens who flee.[[/i]]\\n\\n The Journal of Slavin Kurnz

[[i]]I have deciphered the forbidden texts. Dark runes speak of a "Citadel that howls", a seat of absolute power. The weak fear such a place, but not I  I dare to tread its halls There are gates to be opened, within my mind as well as in the world. I crave to be enlightened.[[/i]]\\n\\n Final entry of Slavin Kurnz, written in his mother-tongue, Kislevarin
